WorkItem.Description:
I have attached a screenshot of my second screen, this is where I open Rawr during my raids and at other times while I play. My second screen is a 15" monitor at 1024 x 768 resolution (natural res).
 
Rawr displays perfectly on my main screen, 20" monitor at 1600 x 900, but I think the cramped look on the smaller screen was unintended :P
 
My main issues with the GUI is that as the screen isn't very tall, icons for my bracers and trinkets are shifted into a second column, leaving very little room for the comparison list, cutting many item names short and rendering the most helpful search function completely unusable unless I move it to my larger screen, which I would prefer not to do in the middle of a raid.
 
I know this is a minor issue, but it's an issue nonetheless. Thanks in advance and for everything you guys have done so far to maintain this amazing program! :)
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] GUI displaying incorrectly on smaller screen

Comments.Message: It's not incorrectly. That's intended, as a way to let it still function for people with horrendously small screens. Additionally, you can use browser zooming on it.

I'm using the offline version, so I can't broswer zoom. Using the browser version zoomed so I don't have to constantly scroll around (vertically and horizontally) results in text well large enough to read for me personally, but too fuzzy to make out individual words.
Guess that means I won't be seeing a fix for this soon, I'll make do with what I have. Thanks tons for the super fast response though :)
Oh, forgot to mention, 15" isn't that small... When i started using Rawr I used it on a separate computer, a laptop with a 15" screen, never had any issues with it :P
15" isn't small; 1024x768 *is*. The physical size doesn't matter at all.
Go to Options > Enable Compact Paper Doll Mode
